intro: Lafoensia scaberrima, commonly known as the rough lafoensia, is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, often thorny stems and dark green, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
